meanings.definition: Remove a fence or barriers from (a piece of land)
meanings.sent1: The farmer was unfencing his field to make it easier for the animals to roam.
meanings.sent2: I will unfence the backyard so the children can play freely.
meanings.sent3: After unfencing the garden, the flowers seemed to dance in the open space.
meanings.sent4: With determination, she unfenced her heart, allowing love to enter.
meanings.sent5: The act of unfencing symbolized freedom and liberation.

meanings.definition: The act of taking down a fence or barriers.
meanings.sent1: The unfencing of the property was met with cheers from the community.
meanings.sent2: The unfencing of the park opened up new possibilities for recreation.
meanings.sent3: The unfencing event turned into a festive celebration with music and food.
meanings.sent4: The unfencing of the school playground brought joy to the children.
meanings.sent5: The unfencing marked the beginning of a new chapter for the neighborhood.
